events.originalText: Beyoncé (pictured) released her fifth studio album without any prior announcement or promotion; it sold 2.3 million copies before the end of the year.
events.subtitle: Beyoncé
events.headline: Beyoncé's Fifth Studio Album Sells 2.3 Million Copies

events.originalText: A man threw grenades and fired a rifle at crowds in Liège, Belgium, causing 6 deaths and injuring more than 120 others, before killing himself.
events.subtitle: 2011 Liège attack
events.headline: 6 Dead in Liège, Belgium Grenade Attack

events.originalText: Croatian War of Independence: The Croatian Army retreated after the failure of Operation Whirlwind, destroying their tanks to avoid their capture.
events.subtitle: Croatian War of Independence
events.headline: Croatian Army Retreats After Operation Whirlwind Failure

events.originalText: The Troubles: The Provisional Irish Republican Army engaged in a fierce firefight with the King's Own Scottish Borderers at a vehicle checkpoint complex in County Fermanagh, Northern Ireland.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Provisional IRA Engages in Firefight in County Fermanagh

events.originalText: Polish prime minister Wojciech Jaruzelski (pictured) declared martial law.
events.subtitle: Wojciech Jaruzelski
events.headline: Polish Prime Minister Declares Martial Law

events.originalText: With Haile Selassie, Emperor of Ethiopia, out of the country, four conspirators staged a coup attempt to install Crown Prince Asfaw Wossen on the throne.
events.subtitle: Haile Selassie
events.headline: Coup Attempt to Install Crown Prince in Ethiopia

events.originalText: Second Sino-Japanese War: Japanese forces, capturing the Chinese city of Nanjing, began committing numerous atrocities over the next several weeks, including looting, rape and the execution of prisoners of war and civilians.
events.subtitle: Second Sino-Japanese War
events.headline: Japanese Forces Commit Atrocities in Nanjing

events.originalText: An American in Paris, a jazz-influenced orchestral piece by George Gershwin, premiered at Carnegie Hall in New York.
events.subtitle: An American in Paris
events.headline: George Gershwin's 'An American in Paris' Premieres at Carnegie Hall

events.originalText: American Civil War: Union forces under Ambrose Burnside suffered severe casualties against entrenched Confederate defenders at the Battle of Fredericksburg in Virginia.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union Forces Suffer Severe Casualties at Battle of Fredericksburg

events.originalText: Napoleonic Wars: While transporting supplies to Guadeloupe, French commodore François Roquebert's expedition to the Caribbean captured the British frigate HMS Junon.
events.subtitle: Napoleonic Wars
events.headline: French Expedition Captures British Frigate HMS Junon

events.originalText: Dartmouth College was established by royal charter in present-day Hanover, New Hampshire.
events.subtitle: Dartmouth College
events.headline: Dartmouth College Established in Hanover, New Hampshire

events.originalText: First English Civil War: Roundhead forces under Sir William Waller led a successful surprise attack in Hampshire on a winter garrison of Cavalier infantry and cavalry.
events.subtitle: First English Civil War
events.headline: Roundhead Forces Lead Successful Attack in Hampshire
